title: Outlook for Orange County
description: William Popejoy, the new chief executive of Orange County, Calif., said tonight that the bankrupt county's financial crisis was "much worse" than he had thought upon assuming office two weeks ago.

title: How Israel Can Regain the Road to Peace
description: To the Editor:

title: At Last, Lessons in Defense Are Sinking In at St. John's
description: When the college basketball season began last November, one of the problems Coach Brian Mahoney admitted his St. John's team would have was learning how to play aggressive, tight defense consistently. Most of his players were young and still operating with the scorer's mentality learned in high school. Selling them on the attention to detail needed to play defense in the Big East has proved to be a slow process.

title: HILLHAVEN AGREES TO ACQUIRE NATIONWIDE CARE
description: The Hillhaven Corporation agreed yesterday to acquire Nationwide Care Inc. and some related businesses for about $120 million in stock. Nationwide, based in Indianapolis, is a closely held operator of 28 nursing and retirement centers in Indiana, Ohio and Florida. Nationwide will receive five million newly issued shares of Hillhaven common stock. The terms are subject to adjustment if the average price of Hillhaven's shares is below $24 before the deal closes. Shares of Hillhaven, which is based in Tacoma, Wash., fell 75 cents, to $24.125, on the New York Stock Exchange yesterday. Hillhaven operates 363 nursing homes, retirement communities and pharmacy outlets in 36 states. It has rejected an offer from the Horizon Healthcare Corporation, based in Albuquerque, N.M., of $28 a share, or about $804 million.

title: Tangerines or Oranges Atop Pork
description: PORK tenderloin with tangerine sauce somehow sounds more exotic than pork tenderloin with orange sauce, but lack of a tangerine should not stop you from making this simple and simply delicious dish: use an orange instead.

title: The Grumbling Gets Louder Over Voting on the Grammys
description: In this week's issue of Billboard, the leading music-industry trade magazine, a full-page ad bought by Geffen Records lists the many magazines, newspapers, critics' polls and readers' polls that have selected "Live Through This," the latest album by Courtney Love's band, Hole, as the best record of 1994. In large yellow print at the bottom of the ad is this sentence: "Recognized by everyone but Naras."

title: Being Born Too Soon Is Worse Than Being Born Too Small
description: A NEW study of more than 7.5 million births has challenged the assumption that low birth weights per se are the cause of the high infant mortality rate in the United States. Rather, the new findings indicate, prematurity is the principal culprit. Being born too soon, rather than too small, is the main underlying cause of stillbirth and infant deaths within four weeks of birth.

title: Republicans Postpone a Balanced-Budget Vote
description: Senate Republicans, a lone Democrat short of the 67 legislators they need to adopt a balanced-budget amendment, reneged tonight on a promise to vote on the measure and abruptly threw the chamber into recess instead.

title: Ecolab Inc.(ECL,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included after-tax charges of $ 8 million, or 12 cents a share, related to merger costs and tax expenses in both the quarter and year.c-Included loss of $ 4,018,000, or 6 cents a share, related to debt retirement; and gain of $ 4,733,000, or 7 cents a share, related to cumulative effect of change in accounting for income taxes.Year-ago results are restated for the company's merger with Kay Chemical Co., which was completed in December 1994.Ecolab reported pro forma net income of $ 24 million, or 35 cents a share, in its latest quarter, compared with pro forma net of $ 22 million, or 32 cents a share, for the year-ago period. Pro forma figures reflect adjustments to eliminate unusual items related to the company's merger with Kay Chemical Co.Latest year had pro forma net income of $ 90 million, or $ 1.34 a share, compared with pro forma net income of $ 81 million, or $ 1.20 a share, in 1993.

title: Real Estate
description: RENOVATION is scheduled to begin in the next few weeks on an empty downtown office building here that has come to symbolize, as much as any single building, the excesses of commercial real estate lending in New England in the 1980's and the depressed economy that followed it.

title: Bean Pies Have Grand New Home
description: In a style as grand and audacious as its leader, the Nation of Islam opened a new $5 million restaurant complex on Chicago's South Side today. The opening marked a return to the food service business that helped establish the Nation, the black Muslim religious sect, as a steady economic presence in African-American neighborhoods across the country in the 1960's and 1970's.

title: Alleghany Corp.(Y,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included net gain of $ 46.1 million, or $ 6.66 a share, from sale of Sacramento Savings, completed Oct. 31, 1994.c-Included net gain of $ 69.1 million, or $ 10.12 a share, from sale of Sacramento Savings, and from discontinued operations prior to the sale.d-Included net income of $ 3.4 million, or 50 cents a share, in the quarter and $ 16.7 million, or $ 2.46 a share, in the year, both from discontinued operations of Sacramento Savings. The year was also after a credit of $ 20 million, or $ 2.94 a share, from tax reserve adjustment.

title: NBC Sits Atop the February Ratings
description: Powered by two new programs and an established favorite, "Seinfeld," NBC climbed to the top of the prime-time ratings for the February "sweep" period, finishing first among all households and first among the 18- to 49-year-old group that advertisers covet.

title: RESULTS PLUS
description: N.B.A. The Spurs Remain Hot David Robinson's 18 points helped the San Antonio Spurs close out an 11-2 month with their sixth straight victory, a 100-83 decision over the visiting Cleveland Cavaliers last night. The Spurs are the hottest team in the National Basketball Association since Dennis Rodman returned from the suspended list on Dec. 10, winning 30 of 37 games.

title: Treasuries Rally to End Day Mixed
description: Fresh economic news yesterday left investors unsure whether the economy was slowing down as much as the Federal Reserve would like, and therefore whether the Fed would find it necessary to raise short-term interest rates once again.

title: ADC Telecommunications Inc.(ADCT,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
description: b-After an extraordinary charge of $ 1,450,000, or 3 cents a share, which reflects cleanup and repair of earthquake damage.Share earnings and shares outstanding are adjusted for a 2-for-1 common stock split to be paid on Feb. 28.

title: General Host Corp.(GH,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 29
description: b-Net loss and included a loss from discontinued operations of $ 840,000, or 4 cents a share, in both the quarter and year.Year-ago quarter and year's loss from continuing operations of $ 41,838,000, or $ 1.99 a share, and $ 55,220,000, or $ 2.67 a share, respectively, included a reserve of $ 22.9 million, in the quarter and $ 22.8 million, in the year, or $ 15.09 million net of tax benefit, for store closings and other costs in both the quarter and year, and a loss of $ 15.7 million and $ 17.7 million for the quarter and year, respectively, from the writedown of its investment in Sunbelt Nursery Group Inc.(Loss)

title: U.S. Plans More Phone Competition
description: The Justice Department's top antitrust official outlined a new policy today that could make it easier for the regional Bell companies to invade the long-distance telephone market and compete against the likes of AT&T, MCI and Sprint.

title: Placer Dome Inc.(PDG,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Coffee-Bar Tipping? The Jury Is Still Out
description: THE coffee of the day is usually hazelnut, and the question of the day is whether to tip for it.

title: NATO Secretary General Questioned in Belgian Scandal
description: A corruption scandal in Belgium involving kickbacks and bribes in the purchase of helicopters from an Italian company has led to the investigation of the Secretary General of NATO.

title: AT WORK WITH: Representative Sonny Bono; I Got Washington, Babe
description: Keeping up with Sonny Bono -- make that Representative Sonny Bono, the California Republican -- is no easy task. He's quick. Fellow members of Congress who want a word with him as he hustles to the House floor to vote must jog alongside. He just keeps on walking.

title: Stocks Fall Sharply in Japan
description: Stocks traded sharply lower here today amid concern about fallout from Barings P.L.C.'s $1 billion loss in derivatives linked to the Japanese market, as well as the yen's strength against the dollar.

title: As World Sees Gingrich: Hurrah Here, Hoot There
description: The Speaker of the Iranian Parliament called Newt Gingrich, the Speaker of the House, an imbecile.

title: Sports of The Times; Ludicrous Sightings Continue
description: YOU see a lot of goofy stuff on television. Our itty-bitty attention spans get overloaded and we click the channel-changer to our hearts' content. Talk shows. Leopards eating zebras. Phony documentaries. Sitcoms. Bad movies. Games. Trials. Chuckleheads on the 11 o'clock news. A cabbie hugging a man in a bear costume on Letterman.

title: When the Table Matters More Than the Meal
description: EVERY restaurant has it, though practically every restaurateur denies it: a best table, the one that, all at once, confers and confirms a customer's status.

title: Moving on Schedule, G.O.P. Stops Short
description: All was moving on the Republican schedule in the Senate as members from both parties made their closing statements about the proposed constitutional amendment to require a balanced budget. Then the Republican train stopped short, one vote shy of the 67 needed for approval.

title: In America; A Nation of Nitwits
description: According to a new poll, 60 percent of Americans are unable to name the President who ordered the nuclear attack on Japan, and 35 percent do not know that the first atomic bomb was dropped on Hiroshima.

title: Key Rates
description: In percent

title: Bindley Western Indus.(BIND,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included restructuring charge of $ 5,388,000 in the quarter and year. The year also included a $ 1,420,000 write-down of accounts receivable.

title: A Search Across Asia For a Missing Trader
description: Police departments across Asia were alerted today to look for Nicholas W. Leeson, the English financial trader who was reported to have jumped into his Porsche and fled this city last Thursday after making disastrous futures trades that lost $1 billion and toppled England's oldest merchant bank, Barings P.L.C.

title: Pillowtex Corp.(PTX,N) reports earnings for Year to Dec 31
description: b-After pro forma adjustment to provision for income taxes.

title: Troubled By Deficit, Persistent In Populism
description: When Kent Conrad arrived in Washington as a freshman Senator in 1987, he staked his political career on the quixotic goal of reducing the Federal budget deficit by 80 percent in his first term. The deficit grew instead, and after six years in office Mr. Conrad declined to run for re-election.

title: Beard Is Ready to Stop Talking And Start Benching Anderson
description: The teacher was tolerant at first, because he was new, and he was willing to give his troubled pupils the benefit of the doubt. Even when things bottomed out, when they stopped listening and started whining, Butch Beard defended the Nets and their franchise players, Kenny Anderson and Derrick Coleman.

title: Alienation, AIDS and Murder, But Keeping a Sense of Humor
description: When the audience at the Vineyard Theater files out for intermission after the first act of Nicky Silver's "Raised in Captivity," it is with a stunned silence seldom associated with comedies of manners. And that is, improbably enough, what this extraordinary new play is.

title: Vanbiesbrouck and Richter Simply Pull Out All Stops
description: There is a big difference between the World Cup soccer tournament, held last summer in the United States, and the Rangers-Panthers hockey game, held last night in Madison Square Garden.

title: CHRONICLE
description: Once again, the show must go on, and never mind that a leading actor is bleeding all over the floor.

title: Trimac Ltd. reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After a loss from discontinued operations of $ 424,000 and an extraordinary charge of 1,451,000 in both the quarter and year.c-Included a pre-tax gain on the sale of assets of $ 684,000 in the quarter and $ 2,514,000 in the year. The quarter also included a loss from discontinued operations of $ 62,000, or 1 cent a share, and the year included $ 340,000, or 1 cent a share.Latest quarter's income from continuing operations of $ 12,115,000, or 30 cents included a pre-tax gain on the sale of assets of $ 3,439,000 and a pre-tax writedown of assets of $ 8,892,000.Fiscal 1994's income from continuing operations of $ 43,404,000, or $ 1.07 a share, included a pre-tax gain on the sale of assets of $ 6,294,000 and a pre-tax writedown of assets of $ 8,892,000.The company said it stopped consolidating Bovar Inc.'s results on Feb. 1, 1994, after its interest in Bovar was diluted to 48 percent from 58 percent.Results are in Canadian dollars.

title: Alexander Julian Licensee Liquidated as Rescue Falters
description: The company that owned the license for Colours by Alexander Julian, a moderately priced line of men's sportswear that is a staple in department stores, has been forced into liquidation.

title: Dow and Hoechst Set Value For Marion at $7.2 Billion
description: Hoechst A.G. of Germany and the Dow Chemical Company, the main participants in the slow takeover minuet being danced around Marion Merrell Dow, Dow's drug subsidiary, have agreed with Marion on one thing: the drug company's value is $25.75 a share, or a little more than $7.2 billion.

title: Leaseway Transportation Corp.(LSWY,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included gains of 64 cents a share from certain changes to non-union employee benefits and a favorable settlement on a disputed tax assessment, partially offset by severance costs in both the quarter and year.c-Included gain of $ 319,474,000 on debt discharge. Prior to the gain, Leaseway had a loss of $ 8,924,000.Fiscal 1993 results are not comparable to 1994 ''due to changes resulting from the implementation of fresh-start accounting in September 1993 when the company completed its financial reorganization.''

title: CUNY Doesn't Burden New York Taxpayers
description: To the Editor:

title: Class Notes
description: Back in the 1920's, the literature teachers and professors of America were in an uproar.

title: Longs Drug Stores Corp.(LDG,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 26
description: b-After an accounting benefit of $ 3,031,000, or 15 cents a share, from the adoption of SFAS No. 109.

title: Market Place; Penny stock prospectus notes: for entertainment purposes only.
description: THE penny stock universe often seems to be a parallel one to the market for real stocks. Prices rise without any evident reason and then -- often after insiders have cashed out -- fall back.

title: Excerpts From Byrd and Dole Remarks on Balanced-Budget Amendment
description: Following are excerpts from today's Senate debate on the constitutional amendment requiring a balanced Federal budget, as transcribed by The New York Times. Speaking were Senators Robert C. Byrd, Democrat of West Virginia; Bob Dole, Republican of Kansas, and Olympia J. Snowe, Republican of Maine and acting president pro tem of the Senate.

title: Eastex Energy (ETEX,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net lossc-Net income(Loss)

title: Roy Lubove, 60, Social Historian At U. of Pittsburgh
description: Dr. Roy Lubove, a social historian and author of seven books in that field, died on Feb. 17 at Montefiore Hospital in Pittsburgh. He was 60 and lived in Pittsburgh.

title: At the Jefferson Courthouse, the Bell Finally Tolls, and Rings Out History
description: FOR 20 minutes on Monday evening, the two-ton bell in the tower of the old Jefferson Market Courthouse rang over Greenwich Village, breaking a virtual silence of 97 years.

title: CHRONICLE
description: For the first time in its 18-year history, the Simon Wiesenthal Center in Los Angeles will present a major award to the leader of a Muslim country: KING HUSSEIN of Jordan, who will receive its Museum of Tolerance Peace Award.

title: Surgical Discovery Brings Drug Charge
description: A 59-year-old woman who arrived at Bronx-Lebanon Hospital Center complaining of stomach pains was charged with drug possession last night, after surgery revealed that she had ingested 109 small bags of what appeared to be narcotics, a police spokesman said.

title: A Special Place in History for Mr. Bush
description: The night before George Bush turned over the White House to Bill Clinton he made a deal with the National Archives that gave him control over his Administration's computerized records. That deal, made in the teeth of a law declaring that all official records are public property, was smelly on its face. It looked even worse when Don Wilson, head of the National Archives, was hired as director of the George Bush Center at Texas A & M University.

title: Foster Wheeler Corp.(FWC,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
The Neediest Cases; Neediest Cases Fund Trails by $208,000
description: Just $208,000 behind last year's total, The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund ends its 83d annual campaign today. As 11th-hour donations continue to arrive, there is still hope of surpassing the $4.59 million collected in 1994.

title: After 102 Years, a Closing
description: Deeply in debt and with its accreditation about to run out, Upsala College is expected to announce today that after 102 years of educating students, it will close May 31.

title: Eating Well
description: TWO years ago, Dr. Walter Mertz, a retired director of the Agriculture Department's Human Nutrition Research Center who has been prescient about more than one food trend, warned about the folly of concentrating on beta carotene to the exclusion of all the other carotenoids. And once again Dr. Mertz appears to have been ahead of the curve. Other researchers are coming to the conclusion that beta carotene alone is not responsible for the health benefits with which it has been endowed.

title: Kim Sang Hyup; South Korean Educator, 74
description: Kim Sang Hyup, a former Cabinet minister and president of Korea University in Seoul, died on Feb. 21 at his home in the South Korean capital. He was 74.

title: COLLEGE BASKETBALL REPORT
description: CUNY Conference

title: High Court Rebuffs S.E.C. On Stock Buyer Protection
description: Rejecting the Securities and Exchange Commission's position, the Supreme Court ruled today that the protections of a potentially powerful securities law extend only to those investors who buy stock in an initial public offering, and not to those who buy shares in subsequent trading.

title: Lawyers Title Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included capital gains of $ 1.5 million.c-Included capital gains of $ 1.4 million in the quarter and $ 8 million in the year.Share earnings and shares outstanding reflects a 3-for-2 stock split effective May 6, 1993.

title: Teacher's Absent. Now What?; New York Schools Face a Chronic Lack of Substitutes
description: On paper, everything was in order. The substitute teacher had the required license and had taught at other schools.

title: Tennis Group Narrows Its Review
description: The Tennis Industry Association, a trade organization in North Palm Beach, Fla., has narrowed a review on its account to 6 agencies from 11. Billings were estimated at $7.5 million. Brad Patterson, executive director, who confirmed a report this week in Adweek, identified the finalists as the Leo Burnett Company in Chicago; Chiat/Day, Grey Entertainment and Media, and Warwick Baker & Fiore, all of New York; Wieden & Kennedy in Portland, Ore., and Young & Rubicam Miami. A decision is expected at the end of April, he said.

title: Gang Leader Details Crimes Of Drug Ring
description: In a chilling monotone, the leader of a $16-million-a-year-drug ring called the Wild Cowboys testified yesterday how he and fellow gang members terrorized the South Bronx and upper Manhattan. He detailed how gang members assassinated their rivals and even recounted his own murder of a man he said had tried to cheat him.

title: No Headline
description: "And then I had nightmares. People I was here in Vietnam with would appear and say: 'You came here on a bicycle ride? Don't you remember how we all suffered in this place? You came here to have fun?' " WILSON HUBBELL, a veteran, back in Vietnam. [ A10:3. ]

title: Houston Industries(HOU,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: The share earnings for the latest year were increased by 10 cents from the adoption of Statement of Position 93-6, ''Employers' Accounting for Employee Stock Ownership Plans.''

title: Salinas's Brother Charged In Mexican Assassination
description: The elder brother of former President Carlos Salinas de Gortari was arrested today on charges of having ordered the assassination of a senior official of the governing party.

title: Tennessean Begins Down-Home Bid for Republican Presidential Nomination
description: Favoring a red-and-black lumberjack shirt over his standard-issue blue suit, Lamar Alexander returned today to his hometown at the edge of the Great Smoky Mountains to declare his candidacy for President with a blistering indictment of the "arrogant empire" in Washington.

title: 'Megan's Law' Suffers Setback In Court Ruling
description: A New Jersey law to monitor sex offenders was dealt a new legal blow today when a Federal judge ruled that its central tenet -- notifying a community of a sex offender's presence -- could not be applied in cases of crimes committed before the law was passed.

title: The Neediest Cases; Another Chance to Extend a Hand
description: Just $208,000 behind last year's total, The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund ends its 83d annual campaign today. As 11th-hour donations continue to arrive, there is still hope of surpassing the $4.59 million collected in 1994.

title: Camelot's Seamy Side, Brazenly Reconstructed
description: AMERICAN TABLOID By James Ellroy 576 pages. Alfred A. Knopf. $25.

title: O'Neal Provides an Answer to Ewing's Prediction
description: It was another statement by the Magic, and this one moved Orlando closer to finishing with the best record in the Eastern Conference.

title: AptarGroup Inc.(ATR,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included a gain from an accounting adjustment of $ 1,400,000, or 9 cents a share.

title: Jets Investing A Lot in Carter And Expecting Bigger Returns
description: After two years of hiring some hoary famous free agents who failed to move the Jets above .500, the team yesterday plucked a player in his prime: Dexter Carter, the dangerous returner and third-down back.

title: Drug Trade Imperils Aid To Colombia
description: Bulkier than most courtroom evidence, two Boeing 727 jets impounded at the international airport here symbolize the push and pull between the United States and Colombia over its rampant cocaine exports.

title: Dive in Stocks Tied to Firm
description: Several Nasdaq stocks underwritten by A. S. Goldmen & Company, a small New York brokerage firm, tumbled yesterday following failures by two other broker-dealers that underwrote or made markets in Nasdaq stocks.

title: Corrections
description: An obituary on Feb. 8 about the actor Willard Waterman misidentified the role he played in the 1958 film "Auntie Mame." He was Mr. Upson; the role of Mr. Babcock was played by Fred Clark.

title: Vietnam Bike Tour Challenges Western Hearts and Minds
description: The man lying in the hammock remembered the supply trucks rumbling past his house at night.

title: A Fresh Wind Is Blowing at Talks
description: The effort may fall short, but negotiators in baseball's labor dispute made it clear today they are earnestly trying to make a deal that would enable legitimate major leaguers to replace the replacement players.

title: Homestake Mining Co.  (HM,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included writedown of $ 16,032,000 in both the quarter and year, and a charge of $ 150,000 in the quarter and $ 8,151,000 in the year, for restructuring and business combinations.

title: Rutgers Wins in an Upset
description: The good news for Rutgers came in two ways tonight. The men's basketball team held off a furious comeback by George Washington and upset the Colonials, 91-87, and there were no demonstrations by protesting students.

title: Paying and Paying for a Prank
description: It may have started as a prank, but it went well beyond that, and the consequences are big-time. One night last August, some boys found a set of keys at Sayreville War Memorial High School. They started a backhoe and used it to wreck six goal posts on the football field and practice area, two baseball backstops, two soccer goals, bleachers -- on and on to the tune of $120,000 in damage.

title: NATO Disputes U.N. Reports of Possible Arms Airlift to Bosnia
description: NATO has issued a report suggesting that United Nations officers were confused and inept in their accounts this month of a possible covert air operation delivering arms to the Bosnian Government, Western officials said today.

title: Metropolitan Diary
description: THE scene is a small foyer outside the Grand Ballroom of the Waldorf-Astoria. The occasion is the American Heart Association's annual benefit dinner-dance.

description: b-Included an after-tax gain of $ 10.5 million on the sale of the Kamloops crude oil pipeline.c-Net incomeResults are in Canadian dollars.(Loss)

title: CHRONICLE
description: NANCY REAGAN has videotaped public service announcements for the Alzheimer's Association and the National Institute of Aging, her office announced yesterday. Her husband, former President Reagan, disclosed in November that he had Alzheimer's, the progressive, irreversible neurological disorder that affects four million Americans.

title: Revco D.S. (RXR,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Feb 4
description: b-After an extraordinary charge of $ 2,800,000, or 5 cents a share, which reflects loss on debt discharge.

title: Executive Changes
description: APPLE COMPUTER INC., Cupertino, Calif., named Marco Landi president of its European operations; he will be responsible for Apple's businesses in Europe, Africa and the Middle East. BOWATER INC., Greenville, S.C., named Arnold M. Nemirow chief executive, succeeding Anthony P. Gammie, who will continue as chairman until March 1996.

title: Bonilla Makes a Pitch to Minor League Players
description: Bobby Bonilla is spending this week traveling to three spring training sites -- Tampa, West Palm Beach and Phoenix -- to answer questions from minor league players, many of whom are faced with the difficult choice of whether to play in spring training games.

It said that, without the impact of reinstating deferred taxes, its per-share earnings would have been 23 cents in the year-earlier quarter and $ 1.04 for all of 1993.

title: A Big Push to Sway Just One Vote
description: The night ended not with a bang, nor with a whimper, but with a remarkable legislative stall.
